channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: 3D Diffuser Actor: Policy Diffusion with 3D Scene Representations
item.description: We marry diffusion policies and 3D scene representations for robot manipulation.

item.title: FedKit: Enabling Cross-Platform Federated Learning for Android and iOS
item.description: We present FedKit, a federated learning (FL) system tailored for cross-platform FL research on Android and iOS devices.

item.title: Steering Conversational Large Language Models for Long Emotional Support Conversations
item.description: In this study, we address the challenge of consistently following emotional support strategies in long conversations by large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Compact and De-biased Negative Instance Embedding for Multi-Instance Learning on Whole-Slide Image Classification
item.description: Using this free annotation, we introduce a semi-supervision signal to de-bias the inter-slide variability and to capture the common factors of variation within normal patches.

item.title: Stochastic Localization via Iterative Posterior Sampling
item.description: Building upon score-based learning, new interest in stochastic localization techniques has recently emerged.

item.title: Personalised Drug Identifier for Cancer Treatment with Transformers using Auxiliary Information
item.description: Cancer remains a global challenge due to its growing clinical and economic burden.

item.title: CodaMal: Contrastive Domain Adaptation for Malaria Detection in Low-Cost Microscopes
item.description: Annotating images from LCM significantly increases the burden on medical experts compared to annotating images from high-cost microscopes (HCM).

item.title: ToolSword: Unveiling Safety Issues of Large Language Models in Tool Learning Across Three Stages
item.description: Tool learning is widely acknowledged as a foundational approach or deploying large language models (LLMs) in real-world scenarios.

item.title: Training Class-Imbalanced Diffusion Model Via Overlap Optimization
item.description: To address the observed appearance overlap between synthesized images of rare classes and tail classes, we propose a method based on contrastive learning to minimize the overlap between distributions of synthetic images for different classes.

item.title: FairSync: Ensuring Amortized Group Exposure in Distributed Recommendation Retrieval
item.description: Specifically, FairSync resolves the issue by moving it to the dual space, where a central node aggregates historical fairness data into a vector and distributes it to all servers.

item.title: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/10438484
item.description: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) can capture local context information well but cannot model the global dependencies.

item.title: Towards Cohesion-Fairness Harmony: Contrastive Regularization in Individual Fair Graph Clustering
item.description: Conventional fair graph clustering methods face two primary challenges: i) They prioritize balanced clusters at the expense of cluster cohesion by imposing rigid constraints, ii) Existing methods of both individual and group-level fairness in graph partitioning mostly rely on eigen decompositions and thus, generally lack interpretability.

item.title: Modelling crypto markets by multi-agent reinforcement learning
item.description: Building on a previous foundation work (Lussange et al. 2020), this study introduces a multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) model simulating crypto markets, which is calibrated to the Binance's daily closing prices of $153$ cryptocurrencies that were continuously traded between 2018 and 2022.

item.title: Linear Transformers with Learnable Kernel Functions are Better In-Context Models
item.description: Advancing the frontier of subquadratic architectures for Language Models (LMs) is crucial in the rapidly evolving field of natural language processing.

item.title: Fitness-based Linkage Learning and Maximum-Clique Conditional Linkage Modelling for Gray-box Optimization with RV-GOMEA
item.description: In addition, we propose a new way to model overlapping dependencies in conditional linkage models to maximize the joint sampling of fully interdependent groups of variables.

item.title: DataDreamer: A Tool for Synthetic Data Generation and Reproducible LLM Workflows
item.description: The rapid rise to prominence of these models and these unique challenges has had immediate adverse impacts on open science and on the reproducibility of work that uses them.

item.title: Conformalized Credal Set Predictors
item.description: Credal sets are sets of probability distributions that are considered as candidates for an imprecisely known ground-truth distribution.

item.title: Weak-Mamba-UNet: Visual Mamba Makes CNN and ViT Work Better for Scribble-based Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Medical image segmentation is increasingly reliant on deep learning techniques, yet the promising performance often come with high annotation costs.

item.title: BlackJAX: Composable Bayesian inference in JAX
item.description: BlackJAX is a library implementing sampling and variational inference algorithms commonly used in Bayesian computation.

item.title: Performance Gaps in Multi-view Clustering under the Nested Matrix-Tensor Model
item.description: We study the estimation of a planted signal hidden in a recently introduced nested matrix-tensor model, which is an extension of the classical spiked rank-one tensor model, motivated by multi-view clustering.

item.title: BitDistiller: Unleashing the Potential of Sub-4-Bit LLMs via Self-Distillation
item.description: The upscaling of Large Language Models (LLMs) has yielded impressive advances in natural language processing, yet it also poses significant deployment challenges.

item.title: Do Llamas Work in English? On the Latent Language of Multilingual Transformers
item.description: Tracking intermediate embeddings through their high-dimensional space reveals three distinct phases, whereby intermediate embeddings (1) start far away from output token embeddings; (2) already allow for decoding a semantically correct next token in the middle layers, but give higher probability to its version in English than in the input language; (3) finally move into an input-language-specific region of the embedding space.

item.title: Let's Learn Step by Step: Enhancing In-Context Learning Ability with Curriculum Learning
item.description: We advocate the few-shot in-context curriculum learning (ICCL), a simple but effective demonstration ordering method for ICL, which implies gradually increasing the complexity of prompt demonstrations during the inference process.

item.title: Genome-AC-GAN: Enhancing Synthetic Genotype Generation through Auxiliary Classification
item.description: We conducted experiments to evaluate the performance of the Genome-AC-GAN and compare the AGs it generates with real genomic data as well as with AGs generated by previously published methods.

item.title: Smaller Language Models are capable of selecting Instruction-Tuning Training Data for Larger Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel training data selection based on the learning percentage of the samples.

item.title: Pushing the Limits of Zero-shot End-to-End Speech Translation
item.description: The speech encoder seamlessly integrates with the MT model at inference, enabling direct translation from speech to text, across all languages supported by the MT model.

item.title: Interpreting CLIP with Sparse Linear Concept Embeddings (SpLiCE)
item.description: CLIP embeddings have demonstrated remarkable performance across a wide range of computer vision tasks.

item.title: Theoretical Understanding of Learning from Adversarial Perturbations
item.description: In this study, we provide a theoretical framework for understanding learning from perturbations using a one-hidden-layer network trained on mutually orthogonal samples.

item.title: STF: Spatio-Temporal Fusion Module for Improving Video Object Detection
item.description: The objective of our work is to leverage this complementary information to improve detection.

item.title: Textual Localization: Decomposing Multi-concept Images for Subject-Driven Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Subject-driven text-to-image diffusion models empower users to tailor the model to new concepts absent in the pre-training dataset using a few sample images.

item.title: MM-Point: Multi-View Information-Enhanced Multi-Modal Self-Supervised 3D Point Cloud Understanding
item.description: In perception, multiple sensory information is integrated to map visual information from 2D views onto 3D objects, which is beneficial for understanding in 3D environments.

item.title: GeoEval: Benchmark for Evaluating LLMs and Multi-Modal Models on Geometry Problem-Solving
item.description: Yet, their proficiency in tackling geometry math problems, which necessitates an integrated understanding of both textual and visual information, has not been thoroughly evaluated.

item.title: QuRating: Selecting High-Quality Data for Training Language Models
item.description: Selecting high-quality pre-training data is important for creating capable language models, but existing methods rely on simple heuristics.

item.title: Unlocking the Potential of Transformers in Time Series Forecasting with Sharpness-Aware Minimization and Channel-Wise Attention
item.description: Transformer-based architectures achieved breakthrough performance in natural language processing and computer vision, yet they remain inferior to simpler linear baselines in multivariate long-term forecasting.

item.title: MC-DBN: A Deep Belief Network-Based Model for Modality Completion
item.description: Recent advancements in multi-modal artificial intelligence (AI) have revolutionized the fields of stock market forecasting and heart rate monitoring.

item.title: X-maps: Direct Depth Lookup for Event-based Structured Light Systems
item.description: We present a new approach to direct depth estimation for Spatial Augmented Reality (SAR) applications using event cameras.

item.title: MIM-Refiner: A Contrastive Learning Boost from Intermediate Pre-Trained Representations
item.description: The motivation behind MIM-Refiner is rooted in the insight that optimal representations within MIM models generally reside in intermediate layers.

item.title: COVIDHealth: A Benchmark Twitter Dataset and Machine Learning based Web Application for Classifying COVID-19 Discussions
item.description: In this study, our primary objective is to develop a machine learning-based web application for automatically classifying COVID-19-related discussions on social media.

item.title: Performative Reinforcement Learning in Gradually Shifting Environments
item.description: Unlike PRL, our framework allows to model scenarios where the environment gradually adjusts to a deployed policy.

item.title: Generative Representational Instruction Tuning
item.description: Notably, we find that GRIT matches training on only generative or embedding data, thus we can unify both at no performance loss.

item.title: FedLion: Faster Adaptive Federated Optimization with Fewer Communication
item.description: In Federated Learning (FL), a framework to train machine learning models across distributed data, well-known algorithms like FedAvg tend to have slow convergence rates, resulting in high communication costs during training.

item.title: A Trembling House of Cards? Mapping Adversarial Attacks against Language Agents
item.description: There is a surprisingly large gap between the speed and scale of their development and deployment and our understanding of their safety risks.

item.title: DE-COP: Detecting Copyrighted Content in Language Models Training Data
item.description: We are motivated by the premise that a language model is likely to identify verbatim excerpts from its training text.

item.title: QUICK: Quantization-aware Interleaving and Conflict-free Kernel for efficient LLM inference
item.description: We introduce QUICK, a group of novel optimized CUDA kernels for the efficient inference of quantized Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: ControlLM: Crafting Diverse Personalities for Language Models
item.description: This heightens the need to control model behaviors.

item.title: Criterion collapse and loss distribution control
item.description: In this work, we consider the notion of "criterion collapse," in which optimization of one metric implies optimality in another, with a particular focus on conditions for collapse into error probability minimizers under a wide variety of learning criteria, ranging from DRO and OCE risks (CVaR, tilted ERM) to non-monotonic criteria underlying recent ascent-descent algorithms explored in the literature (Flooding, SoftAD).

item.title: DreamMatcher: Appearance Matching Self-Attention for Semantically-Consistent Text-to-Image Personalization
item.description: The objective of text-to-image (T2I) personalization is to customize a diffusion model to a user-provided reference concept, generating diverse images of the concept aligned with the target prompts.

item.title: ViGEO: an Assessment of Vision GNNs in Earth Observation
item.description: Satellite missions and Earth Observation (EO) systems represent fundamental assets for environmental monitoring and the timely identification of catastrophic events, long-term monitoring of both natural resources and human-made assets, such as vegetation, water bodies, forests as well as buildings.

item.title: How to validate average calibration for machine learning regression tasks ?
item.description: Average calibration of the uncertainties of machine learning regression tasks can be tested in two ways.

item.title: Detecting CSV File Dialects by Table Uniformity Measurement and Data Type Inference
item.description: The human-readable simplicity with which the CSV format was devised, together with the absence of a standard that strictly defines this format, has allowed the proliferation of several variants in the dialects with which these files are written.
